page.title: 16TRANSPORT IN BRENTWOOD
page.content:
The town has good road and rail communications. 3km west of the town centre is a large interchange where the M25 (London Orbital Motorway) crosses the A12 London to Chelmsford road which by-passes Brentwood. A survey of traffic was taken at 1100-1115 on Wednesday 5th June 1985 {Cars Lorries/Coaches} {M25 South} 316 168 { North} 225 187
{A12 West} 226 117 { East} 196 114 The station was opened in 1840. About 200 trains run per day. It takes 19 minutes on a fast train to get to London. Because of heavy traffic in London the car journey is very slow. Users complained of dirty trains, poor service and high prices.There are also services to Chelmsford and Southend.
